name: Al Jazari Institute
mission: To provide quality Islamic education to our students while instilling in them Islamic character, morals, and ethics.
theoryOfChange: Providing intensive Islamic education and detailed progress reporting to instill Islamic character, morals, and ethics in students to nurture future leaders.
zakatClaimEvidence: The search results for the US-based Al Jazari Institute (located in Minneapolis, MN) describe its mission as providing Islamic educational services, including Quranic studies and Arabic language training. There is no explicit mention of 'zakat' on their website or donation pages, nor any dedicated zakat funds or campaigns for the US entity in the provided snippets. While a 'Jazari' entity in the UK explicitly mentions 'Zakat Payment Options', this is an international affiliate and does not apply to the US organization. (Source: https://www.charitynavigator.org/ein/455134951#financials)

ui_signals_v1.recommendation_rationale: Good donor alignment with manageable risk. Evidence quality is solid but still evolving in places.

dimension_explanations.alignment: With an alignment score of 31/50, the organization shows a medium fit for donors interested in global education and religious literacy [1]. The mission focuses on sadaqah-eligible activities including community engagement and the preservation of Islamic sciences [2].
dimension_explanations.impact: The institute allocates a program expense ratio of 68.6% toward its core mission of Islamic and civic education [2]. While it demonstrates high fundraising efficiency, its impact score of 29/50 reflects a capacity-building model and a working capital reserve of 3.0 months [1].

baseline_narrative.headline: The AL Jazari Institute provides comprehensive Islamic education and civic engagement programs to empower individuals and families within the community.
strengths: High fundraising efficiency with only $0.09 spent to raise every $1
Direct focus on specialized religious and civic education programs

peer_comparison.differentiator: Distinguished by strong earned income, with <cite id="8">$1,389,723 in program service revenue</cite>.

strengths.detail: The organization is highly efficient in its development efforts, spending only <cite id="3">$0.09 per $1 raised</cite>.
The institute has demonstrated consistent financial expansion with a <cite id="4">22.6% 3-year revenue CAGR</cite>.
Financial stability is supported by significant earned income, including <cite id="8">$1,389,723 in program service revenue</cite>.

strengths_deep_dive: The AL Jazari Institute shows a strong trajectory of growth and financial sustainability. Its <cite id="4">22.6% 3-year revenue CAGR</cite> indicates expanding community support and program reach. Furthermore, the organization's ability to generate <cite id="8">$1,389,723 in program service revenue</cite> alongside <cite id="7">$1,586,418 in contributions</cite> demonstrates a balanced funding model that reduces reliance on purely philanthropic giving. This is achieved with excellent fundraising efficiency, requiring only <cite id="3">$0.09 per $1 raised</cite>.
rich_narrative.summary: The AL Jazari Institute is a US-based organization dedicated to providing comprehensive Islamic education and civic engagement programs. In 2023, the organization reported <cite id="1">$2,997,604 in total revenue</cite>, supported by a mix of <cite id="7">$1,586,418 in contributions</cite> and <cite id="8">$1,389,723 in program service revenue</cite>. The institute focuses its curriculum on <cite id="6">Qur'anic Sciences and Islamic Sciences</cite>, alongside Arabic programs and general Islamic studies. Financially, the organization operates with a <cite id="2">68.6% program expense ratio</cite> and demonstrates strong fundraising efficiency, spending just <cite id="3">$0.09 per $1 raised</cite>. Over the past three years, the institute has experienced significant growth, achieving a <cite id="4">22.6% 3-year revenue CAGR</cite>. The organization maintains <cite id="5">3.0 months of working capital</cite> in working capital and reports <cite id="9">$1,749,224 in total assets</cite> against <cite id="10">$960,784 in total liabilities</cite>. Governance is supported by <cite id="11">100% independent board members</cite> and modest <cite id="12">$26,400 officer compensation</cite>.
